SiteDesignation.ReferenceSPA: National legal reference of SPA designation
SiteDesignation.ReferenceSAC: National legal reference of SAC designation

HabitatTypess.2: Coastal sand dunes and inland dunes
HabitatTypess.7: Raised bogs and mires and fens

HabitatClasses.N02: Tidal rivers, Estuaries, Mud flats, Sand flats, Lagoons (including saltwork basins)
HabitatClasses.N03: Salt marshes, Salt pastures, Salt steppes
HabitatClasses.N04: Coastal sand dunes, Sand beaches, Machair
HabitatClasses.N06: Inland water bodies (Standing water, Running water)
HabitatClasses.N07: Bogs, Marshes, Water fringed vegetation, Fens
HabitatClasses.N08: Heath, Scrub, Maquis and Garrigue, Phygrana
HabitatClasses.N12: Extensive cereal cultures (including Rotation cultures with regular fallowing)
HabitatClasses.N20: Artificial forest monoculture (e.g. Plantations of poplar or Exotic trees)
HabitatClasses.N21: Non-forest areas cultivated with woody plants (including Orchards, groves, Vineyards, Dehesas)
HabitatClasses.N22: Inland rocks, Screes, Sands, Permanent Snow and ice
HabitatClasses.N23: Other land (including Towns, Villages, Roads, Waste places, Mines, Industrial sites)

HabitatTypes.PF: For the habitat types that can have a non-priority as well as a priority form (6210, 7130, 9430) enter 'X' in the column PF to indicate the priority form.
HabitatTypes.NP: In case that a habitat type no longer exists in the site enter: x (optional)
HabitatTypes.Caves: For habitat types 8310, 8330 (caves) enter the number of caves if estimated surface is not available.
HabitatTypes.Data Quality: G = 'Good' (e.g. based on surveys), M = 'Moderate' (e.g. based on partial data with some extrapolation), P = 'Poor' (e.g. rough estimation)
HabitatTypes.Representativity: A = excellent representativity, B = good representativity, C = significant representativity, D = non-significant presence
HabitatTypes.Conservation: A = excellent conservation, B = good conservation, C = average or reduced conservation
HabitatTypes.Global Assesment: A = excellent value, B = good value, C = significant value

Species.Group: A = Amphibians, B = Birds, F = Fish, I = Invertebrates, M = Mammals, P = Plants, R = Reptiles
Species.S: In case that the data on species are sensitive and therefore have to be blocked for any public access enter: Yes
Species.NP: In case that a species is no longer present in the site enter: x (optional)
Species.Type: p = permanent, r = reproducing, c = concentration, w = wintering (for plant and non-migratory species use permanent)
Species.Unit: i = individuals, p = pairs or other units according to the Standard list of population units and codes in accordance with Article 12 and 17 reporting (see reference portal)
Species.Abundance Categories: C = common, R = rare, V = very rare, P = present - to fill if data are deficient (DD) or in addition to population size information
Species.Data Quality: G = 'Good' (e.g. based on surveys), M = 'Moderate' (e.g. based on partial data with some extrapolation), P = 'Poor' (e.g. rough estimation), VP = 'Very poor' (use this category only, if not even a rough estimation of the population size can be made, in this case the fields for population size can remain empty, but the field 'Abundance categories' has to be filled in)
Species.Population: A = >15%, B = 2-15%, C = <2%, D = non-significant population
Species.Conservation: A = excellent conservation, B = good conservation, C = average or reduced conservation
Species.Isolation: A = population (almost) isolated, B = population not-isolated, but on the margins of are of distribution, C = population not-isolated withing extended distribution range
Species.Global Assessment: A = excellent value, B = good value, C = significant value

OtherSpecies.Group: A = Amphibians, B = Birds, F = Fish, Fu = Fungi, I = Invertebrates, L = Lichens, M = Mammals, P = Plants, R = Reptiles
OtherSpecies.Code: For Birds, Annex IV and V species the code as provided in the reference portal should be used in addition to the scientific name
OtherSpecies.S: In case that the data on species are sensitive and therefore have to be blocked for any public access enter: Yes
OtherSpecies.NP: In case that a species is no longer present in the site enter: x (optional)
OtherSpecies.Unit: i = individuals, p = pairs or other units according to the Standard list of population units and codes in accordance with Article 12 and 17 reporting (see reference portal)
OtherSpecies.Abundance Categories: C = common, R = rare, V = very rare, P = present - to fill if data are deficient (DD) or in addition to population size information
OtherSpecies.Motivation Categories: IV, V: Annex Species (Habitats Directive), A: National Red List data, B: Endemics, C: International Conventions, D: other reasons

Threats.Rank: H = high, M = medium, L = low
Threats.Pollution: N = Nitrogen input, P = Phosphor/Phosphate input, A = Acid input/acidification, T = toxic inorganic chemicals, O = toxic organic chemicals, X = Mixed pollutions
Threats.Occurrence: i = inside, o = outside, b = both
